org.vngx.jsch

Class Session

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.vngx.jsch.Session
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public final class Session
extends Object
implements Runnable
    TODO Add support for setting a ThreadFactory instance for creating all sub threads in session and its channels TODO Add a reset method which resets all the state variables after disconnecting from the SSH server or when the connect method runs
    Author:
    Atsuhiko Yamanaka, Michael Laudati

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public void connect()
             throws JSchException
        Starts the SSH session by connecting to the remote host, establishing a key exchange, determining encryption methods and performing the user authentication/authorization.
        Throws:
        JSchException - if any errors occur

      • connect

        public void connect(byte[] password)
             throws JSchException
        Throws:
        JSchException

      • connect

        public void connect(int connectTimeout)
             throws JSchException
        Throws:
        JSchException

      • connect

        public void connect(int connectTimeout,
                    byte[] password)
             throws JSchException
        Starts the SSH session by connecting to the remote host, establishing a key exchange, determining encryption methods and performing the user authentication/authorization. The specified timeout in milliseconds is used when negotiating the connection. Note: The connect timeout value will not set the timeout for the session, it will only be used during the initial connection. To set the socket timeout for the entire session, use setTimeout(int).
        Parameters:
        connectTimeout - in milliseconds
        password - for connecting
        Throws:
        JSchException - if any errors occur

      • rekey

        public void rekey()
           throws Exception
        Requests the server to perform a new key exchange for the session using any update key exchange proposals set in the session's configuration.
        Throws:
        Exception - if any errors occur

      • openChannel

        public Channel openChannel(String type)
                    throws JSchException
        Opens a new Channel of the specified type. The type should be one of the supported types defined by ChannelType as official SSH channels.
        Parameters:
        type - of channel to open
        Returns:
        new channel instance
        Throws:
        JSchException - if any errors occur
        See Also:
        openChannel(ChannelType type)

      • openChannel

        public <T extends Channel> T openChannel(ChannelType type)
                                  throws JSchException
        Creates a new Channel instance of the specified type for this session. Once a Channel has been created, the user must call the connect() method in order to connect the channel through the session.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of channel instance
        Parameters:
        type - of channel to open
        Returns:
        new channel instance
        Throws:
        JSchException - if the session is down or if the channel cannot be opened or if any other unspecified error occurs

      • read

        public Buffer read(Buffer buffer)
            throws JSchException,
                   IOException
        Reads from the session's socket input stream into the specified buffer performing any required decoding and handling any global requests before returning the input buffer.
        Parameters:
        buffer - to fill with data read in
        Returns:
        buffer instance passed in
        Throws:
        JSchException - if any errors occur
        IOException - if any IO errors occur

      • write

        public void write(Packet packet)
           throws JSchException,
                  IOException
        Writes the specified SSH packet to the output stream sending it to the remote SSH server. If the session is currently in the process of a key exchange, then only key exchange packets will be allowed to send; any other packets will wait until the key exchange is complete.
        Parameters:
        packet - to send
        Throws:
        JSchException - if any errors occur
        IOException - if any IO errors occur

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnects the session including any open channels and closes any open resources (input and output streams, socket, proxy, etc).

      • sendIgnore

        public void sendIgnore()
                throws Exception
        Sends an SSH Ignore packet for the session on the transport layer. All implementations must understand (and ignore) this message at any time (after receiving the identification string). No implementation is required to send them. This message can be used as an additional protection measure against advanced traffic analysis techniques.
        Throws:
        Exception - if any errors occur

      • sendKeepAliveMsg

        public void sendKeepAliveMsg()
                      throws Exception
        Sends an SSH keep alive message for the session on the transport layer.
        Throws:
        Exception - if any errors occur

      • getConfig

      • setSocketFactory

        public void setSocketFactory(SocketFactory socketFactory)
        Sets the SocketFactory instance to use for creating the Socket to the remote SSH host. By default the factory is null, which uses the default socket create method in Util. Note: The factory must be set prior to calling connect() if required.
        Parameters:
        socketFactory -

      • setProxy

        public void setProxy(Proxy proxy)
        Sets the Proxy instance to proxy the SSH session through. By default the proxy is null, indicating no proxying will be used. Note: The proxy must be set prior to calling connect() if required. Note: If the session is disconnected, the proxy connection is closed and the proxy is set to null; it needs to be explicitly set again before attempting to reconnect if it's required.
        Parameters:
        proxy - to pass SSH connection through

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Returns true if the session is currently connected to the remote host.
        Returns:
        true if session is connected to SSH server

      • isAuthenticated

        public boolean isAuthenticated()
        Returns true if the session is currently connected && authenticated.
        Returns:
        true if authenticated

      • getTimeout

        public int getTimeout()
        Returns the timeout in milliseconds used on the socket connection to the remote host. A value of zero indicates no timeout.
        Returns:
        timeout in milliseconds
        See Also:
        Socket.setSoTimeout(int)

      • setTimeout

        public void setTimeout(int timeout)
                throws JSchException
        Sets the timeout in milliseconds used on the socket connection to the remote host. A value of zero indicates no timeout.
        Parameters:
        timeout - in milliseconds (zero for no timeout)
        Throws:
        JSchException - if any errors occur
        See Also:
        Socket.setSoTimeout(int)
